posts.post_content: One of the single most important cards in any of the Eternal formats (Vintage, Legacy and Classic). This card has been called "the glue" that holds Vintage (aka Type 1) together. Without this card keeping it in check, Combo would run rampant.

Posted By: draco_nite (4/5/2011 1:13:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Simply put, you'll love this card when you're using it, and hate it when it's used against you. It's both the best card at stopping combos going off, and the best card at protecting said combos.  
  
What I hate though is 'casual' players running it along side infinite combos and thinking there's no problem with the power level of their decks. "Nah man, an infinite combo + a free counterspell to protect it isn't too hardcore".
posts.html:
Simply put, you'll love this card when you're using it, and hate it when it's used against you. It's both the best card at stopping combos going off, and the best card at protecting said combos.

What I hate though is 'casual' players running it along side infinite combos and thinking there's no problem with the power level of their decks. "Nah man, an infinite combo + a free counterspell to protect it isn't too hardcore".

posts.post_content:
!! Force of Will reprinted !! ... **!!! with new artwork !!!** ... It's for real, take a look:  
  
http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/arcana/764  
  
...well okay, it's nearly the size of a highway sign and literally one-of-a-kind, but still. The new art's gorgeous.  
  
Funniest card I've ever seen pitched to Force: [Phelddagrif](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phelddagrif). Hey, there really was a time when people actually played other Alliances cards. (I don't think it minded getting exiled. Phelddagrifs love helping people.)  
  
When Alliances was first released, most everyone was also excited about [Balduvian Horde](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balduvian Horde), a 5/5 for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol). We pretty much all knew Force of Will was awesome; it just wasn't clear at the time how many heads and shoulders it would stand above every other card from the time period. More amazing than [Diminishing Returns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diminishing Returns)? Sure, okay, defense > offense in this case. One heavily played Force worth the same as thirty mint Diminis... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Salient (8/21/2011 11:58:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: My favorite thing about this card (OK, next to the fact that it's one of the best cards in the game) is its flavor. I *love* blue cards like this and [Mind Over Matter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Over Matter) that imply that blue mages have such powerful minds that they can directly influence the world around them *just by thinking hard enough*, at the cost of causing enormous mental strain (losing a card from your hand). "No, I didn't cast a spell that disrupted your [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath); I just concentrated hard enough on it not happening, and it didn't happen."
posts.html:
My favorite thing about this card (OK, next to the fact that it's one of the best cards in the game) is its flavor. I love blue cards like this and Mind Over Matter that imply that blue mages have such powerful minds that they can directly influence the world around them just by thinking hard enough, at the cost of causing enormous mental strain (losing a card from your hand). Posted By: Lifegainwithbite (5/16/2013 3:19:46 PM)

posts.post_content:
Technically it is a loss in card advantage (you give up 2 cards but only counter one) but it is a huge gain in mana advantage because you give up 0 and get rid of many of theirs. Then you realize that Black Lotus is another card that costs a card advantage and gives mana advantage, and this card will actually give MORE mana advantage than black lotus does when you counter a card with a CMC > 3.   
  
This card is the [black lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=black lotus) [counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=counterspell). The control equivalent of lotus.
posts.html:
Technically it is a loss in card advantage (you give up 2 cards but only counter one) but it is a huge gain in mana advantage because you give up 0 and get rid of many of theirs. Then you realize that Black Lotus is another card that costs a card advantage and gives mana advantage, and this card will actually give MORE mana advantage than black lotus does when you counter a card with a CMC > 3.

This card is the black lotus counterspell. The control equivalent of lotus.

posts.post_content:
I've only ever seen this hardcast once, and that was when my opponent was at 1 life. New players may think of this as a five-mana counterspell, but it's not — it's a two-card counterspell instead. All things considered, losing a card in your hand isn't much of a drawback, especially considering all the card draw blue gets.  
  
@Purple\_Shrimp: Are you fucking kidding me? "pretty bad except vs combo" It's good against damn near everything! If you've never been crushed by this card, you've never played Legacy.
